In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code for `wrap_string` in Julia language:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_str)
    wrapped_str = ""
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= "$word "
        else
            wrapped_str *= "$current_line\n"
            current_line = "$word "
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        wrapped_str *= current_line
    end
    
    return chomp(wrapped_str)  # remove trailing newline
end
```

Here's an example of how to use this function:

```julia
input_str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_str)
println("Wrapped text:\n$wrapped_text")
```

This will print:

```
Wrapped text:
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit.
```
